# findNext(_:)

**Instance Method**

Finds the next match in your app’s interface.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func findNext(_ sender: Any?)
```

## Parameters

- **sender**: The object calling this method.

## Discussion

UIKit calls this method when the user selects the Find Next command from an editing menu. Your implementation should highlight the next result in the UI for finding textual content in your view.

For example, a view using a find interaction might call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIFindSession/highlightNextResult(in:)] to update the find session.

## Handling find and replace commands

- **find(_:)**: Begins a search for content in your app’s interface.
- **findPrevious(_:)**: Finds the previous match in your app’s interface.
- **findAndReplace(_:)**: Begins a search for content in your app’s interface and provides a replacement.
- **useSelectionForFind(_:)**: Begins a search for the selected content in your app’s interface.
